blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: i seem to be drawn to endings in all my life; i discovered CoT and binge-read it, at most, a week before the penultimate chapter...
question: i seem to be drawn to endings in all my life; i discovered CoT and binge-read it, at most, a week before the penultimate chapter went up. now i've just finished the last chapter, and i wish i could have been along for more of the ride. i don't think i've ever called a story pretty, but this one is, with all the awe and frailty that that entails. everyone (at least everyone truly important) in it is so kind, and now they are all important to me.
answer:
Oh, wow.  You might be the closest-to-ending arrival of a new reader I know about.  The years-long readers will probably tell you that it wasn’t always ideal; there were often 6-month-to-a-year gaps between updates even once I really picked up the momentum in 2012.  Those gaps made a lot of folks uneasy, because the first thing many readers think in the absence of updates is that the series might end up abandoned.  Once we hit about the 2014-15 mark, though, and updates stayed consistent (even if far apart), I think people relaxed somewhat and realized I wasn’t walking away from it.  What they didn’t know at that point was that I’d eventually give it a definitive ending, because my original plan was to keep adding to it for as long as I was around to do so.  My mind changed about that ca. 2015, though, I think.  I could discern a fitting end in sight.

Thank you, @almostunadulteratedmiracle, for taking a chance on it at the eleventh hour.  All I can say is that there are now readers who will have the experience of reading it all at once, and you may be the first to have done so!

Thank you, @almostunadulteratedmiracle, for taking a chance on it at the eleventh hour.  All I can say is that there are now readers who will have the experience of reading it all at once, and you may be the first to have done so!

Oh, wow.  You might be the closest-to-ending arrival of a new reader I know about.  The years-long readers will probably tell you that it wasn’t always ideal; there were often 6-month-to-a-year gaps between updates even once I really picked up the momentum in 2012.  Those gaps made a lot of folks uneasy, because the first thing many readers think in the absence of updates is that the series might end up abandoned.  Once we hit about the 2014-15 mark, though, and updates stayed consistent (even if far apart), I think people relaxed somewhat and realized I wasn’t walking away from it.  What they didn’t know at that point was that I’d eventually give it a definitive ending, because my original plan was to keep adding to it for as long as I was around to do so.  My mind changed about that ca. 2015, though, I think.  I could discern a fitting end in sight.

Thank you, @almostunadulteratedmiracle, for taking a chance on it at the eleventh hour.  All I can say is that there are now readers who will have the experience of reading it all at once, and you may be the first to have done so!

summary: “They came down the outside lane of the motorway like destroying angels, which was fair enough. They weren't going that fast,...
caption: “They came down the outside lane of the motorway like destroying angels, which was fair enough. They weren’t going that fast, all things considered. The four of them were holding a steady 105 mph, as if they were confident that the show could not start before they got there. It couldn’t. They had all the time in the world, such as it was.”  (Good Omens. Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman)

summary: ‘... He had heard about talking to plants in the early seventies, on Radio Four, and thought it was an excellent idea. Although...
body:
‘… He had heard about talking to plants in the early seventies, on Radio Four, and thought it was an excellent idea. Although talking is perhaps the wrong word for what Crowley did.

What he did was put the fear of God into them.

More precisely, the fear of Crowley.’

reblog.comment:
‘… He had heard about talking to plants in the early seventies, on Radio Four, and thought it was an excellent idea. Although talking is perhaps the wrong word for what Crowley did.

What he did was put the fear of God into them.

More precisely, the fear of Crowley.’

More precisely, the fear of Crowley.’

summary: Oh no I must away to my mum in disarray / If my mother should discover how I spent my holiday / It would be of small avail to...
body:
Oh no I must away to my mum in disarray / If my mother should discover how I spent my holiday / It would be of small avail to talk of magic in the air / I’ll say farewell

So …War got her sword while she was on holiday in the Mediterranean then left the island in a complete shambles.

O rock of ages, do not crumble, love is breathing still

trail.content_raw:
Oh no I must away to my mum in disarray / If my mother should discover how I spent my holiday / It would be of small avail to talk of magic in the air / I’ll say farewell

So …War got her sword while she was on holiday in the Mediterranean then left the island in a complete shambles.

O rock of ages, do not crumble, love is breathing still
trail.content:

O rock of ages, do not crumble, love is breathing still
